remarks:
If ` x ` is not free in ` ph ` and ` ps ` , it is not free in ` ( ph <-> ps ) ` .  (Contributed by NM, 26-May-1993.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 11-Aug-2016.)  (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 2-Jan-2018.) 

---

 If ` x ` is not free in ` ph ` and ` ps ` , it is not free in ` ( ph <-> ps ) ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Aug-2016.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 2-Jan-2018.)
statement:
nf.1 $e |- F/ x ph $.
nf.2 $e |- F/ x ps $.
nfbi $p |- F/ x ( ph <-> ps ) $.
